text: Judy Stiegler (born July 4, 1953) is an American Democratic politician who served in the Oregon House of Representatives from 2009 until 2011. ==Biography== Stiegler was born in Montrose, Colorado in 1953. She graduated from the University of Oregon with a Bachelor of Science in 1975, and from Lewis and Clark College with a Juris Doctor in 1978. Stiegler served on the board of the Bend-La Pine School District from 1989 until 1992, and became President of the National Association of State Boards of Education in 2000. She defeated incumbent Republican State Representative Chuck Burley in 2008. Stiegler ran for reelection in 2010 but was defeated by Republican Jason Conger. ==Personal life== Stiegler is married to Mike Dugan, and they have two children, Daniel and Molly. They attend First Presbyterian Church in Bend. ==References== Category:Living people Category:1953 births Category:Oregon Democrats Category:Members of the Oregon House of Representatives Category:Women state legislators in Oregon Category:Politicians from Bend, Oregon Category:People from Montrose, Colorado Category:University of Oregon alumni Category:Lewis & Clark Law School alumni Category:Oregon lawyers Category:American Presbyterians Category:School board members in Oregon Category:21st-century American politicians Category:21st-century American women politicians
title: Judy Stiegler
